newsitem.title: PANAMA: Strong quake shakes western Panama.
newsitem.headline: Strong quake shakes western Panama.

text.p: An earthquake measuring 5.1 on the Richter scale shook western Panama early on Tuesday causing panic among residents but no injuries, Panama's National Geoseismic Centre said.
The quake struck at 12:43 p.m. EDT (1643 GMT) on Tuesday and was centred on the border with Costa Rica, some 37 miles (60 km) off Panama's western coast near Panama's third-largest city, David.
The tremor rocked the centre of David and caused slight damage to the interior of homes, due to falling objects.
Jorge Toral, of the National Geoseismic Centre, said structural damages were "very superficial" and there were no injuries.
